converse.line: My, my. Emere. How's the job been?
It's good teaching children art. I just wish I had more time for working on personal projects like when I worked with you.
The life of an artist is tough. We've been given the job to probe and explore the creative frontier for other people's enjoyment.
I overheard you talking with Masaru. I would be glad to quickly paint a picture for you.
Sorry to make you do this.

It's fine. The only problem is I've run one of my brushes out as all the bristles on the end are gone. It's a thick brush that the store doesn't sell, and I can't paint something big enough for a whole town to see without it. Do you own a large brush I could borrow?
No, I don't. Sorry. I'll look around and see if I can find one.
I either need a new brush or I could glue some large, thick bristles on if that's easier to find.
(How would large bristles be easier to find? It's not like I can skin an animal of its hair.)
Tanvir gave me some of his hair to use as bristles.
That poor man! He must be in a lot of pain.
These hairs will do, they're nice and soft. Well, I'll pack some supplies and head out for Tanvir's house. Meet me there to pick up the drawing later today.
Ah, Emere. Just in time. I've finished painting Tanvir. I'll let you be the judge of how good it looks.
It looks great for the amount of time you had to spend on it! I'll give this to Masaru.
Give the picture to my husband.

random.line: Have you seen the new painting the mayor bought? It looks amazing.
No, but I've heard of it. It's by the famous artist, Emelia Spanner, right? Her paintings are worth top dollar.
It's a painting depicting a landscape of a castle surrounded by flowers. It's beautiful.
I'll have to see it some time.
I'd like to have you review a piece of art I've been working on.
Is it one of your paintings?
No, it's a sculpture I've made.
It's... interesting. What is it of exactly?
You don't see it? It's supposed to be a dog.
Oh. Why does it have a bean shaped head?
It's Bean Dog. I guess you're too old to get the reference.
It's my mom's birthday soon. What should I get her?
Well, parents love homemade gifts. Why don't you paint for her?
Fluffy kitten, huh...That might work. Thanks!
